content.body: this is a very fun writeup of a CVE in chrome which happened as a consequence of a change to TypedArrays in the spec: https://tiszka.com/blog/CVE_2021_21225.html
also serves as a good concrete example of Symbol.species causing bad things to happen
yes, that was a "i'm in this picture and i don't like it" situation

Looking at https://github.com/tc39/proposal-pattern-matching/issues/168#issuecomment-814216217, I’m wondering: Is it a goal to forever avoid the Bad Keywords (`eval`, `with`, `switch`) in new syntax? That is, is it a committee invariant that those three keywords not be used in any new syntax going forward?
content.formatted_body: Looking at https://github.com/tc39/proposal-pattern-matching/issues/168#issuecomment-814216217, I’m wondering: Is it a goal to forever avoid the Bad Keywords (eval, with, switch) in new syntax? That is, is it a committee invariant that those three keywords not be used in any new syntax going forward?

content.body: and i've seen ideas float around that want to co-opt `with` for more useful purposes, it's a nice keyword
content.formatted_body: and i've seen ideas float around that want to co-opt with for more useful purposes, it's a nice keyword

content.body: so it's not an invariant from my perspective
Yeah, I mean Bad Words in general, I guess, heh. An example for `eval`: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-do-expressions/issues/53#issuecomment-771789167
content.formatted_body: Yeah, I mean Bad Words in general, I guess, heh. An example for eval: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-do-expressions/issues/53#issuecomment-771789167

content.body: I suppose I haven’t seen anything about this with `with` yet; I had assumed it was in a similar situation to `switch` etc.
